intro: Hybosema robustum, commonly known as the robust hybosema, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
